p:
The Asian tiger mosquito, Aedes albopictus (Skuse) (Diptera Culicidae) is ranked among the most invasive mosquito species in the world
1 . Native to the tropical and subtropical areas of Southeast Asia, in recent time, Ae. albopictus has spread across many countries including Europe, North and South America, and Africa
2 . Besides its aggressive daytime biting behaviour, the medical importance of Ae. albopictus is due to its ability to transmit many human pathogens and parasites (e.g. yellow fever, dengue fever, West Nile, Japanese encephalitis, St. Louis encephalitis, chikungunya viruses, filarial nematodes)
3 .
